summary: "Public Speaking" is a feature-length documentary starring Fran Lebowitz, a writer known for her unique take on modern life.  The film, directed by Martin Scorsese, is in the vein of his early documentaries such as "American Boy" and "Italian American". "Public Speaking" weaves together extemporaneous monologues featuring Fran Lebowitz with archival footage.  The effect is a portrait of Fran's worldview and experiences.
title: Public Speaking
